abstract.text: Initiates a grammatical analysis of a given string.

inlineContent.text: String to analyze.
Location within
at which to start the analysis.
Language use in
. When
, the language selected in the Spelling panel is used.
to specify that the analysis continue to the beginning of string when the end is reached.
to have the analysis stop at the end of string.

An identifier unique within the application used to inform the spell checker which document that text is associated, potentially for many purposes, not necessarily just for ignored words. A value of 0 can be passed in for text not associated with a particular document.
On output, dictionaries describing grammar-analysis details within the flagged grammatical unit. See the
class for information about these dictionaries.
Location of the first flagged grammatical unit.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An interface to the Cocoa spell-checking service.
Requests unified text checking for the given range of the given string.
Initiates a grammatical analysis of a given string.
Starts the search for a misspelled word in
starting at
within the string object.
Starts the search for a misspelled word in a string starting at specified offset within the string.
Returns the number of words in the specified string.
Returns an array of possible substitutions for the specified string.
Returns an array of suggested spellings for the misspelled word.
Requests that the string be checked in the background.
A server that your app uses to provide a spell checker service to other apps running in the system.
A false value.
A true value.
A Swift-only concrete structure that backs the range type alias.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Describes an integer.
An object representing a static ordered collection, for use instead of an  constant in cases that require reference semantics.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A mutable pointer addressing an Objective-C reference that doesn’t own its target.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A signed integer value type.
